text.section:
Each professional and paraprofessional member of the program staff shall:
As appropriate to their disciplines, have special training in the psychosocial aspects of deafness and therapeutic work with hearing impaired individuals in mental health and related settings; and
Be fluent in receptive and expressive manual communication, including the American Sign Language, or, within 1 year after employment, be fluent at a level acceptable to the Director.

The professional staff of the program shall have experience in:
Techniques of assessment of hearing impaired individuals; and
Individual and group psychotherapy with hearing impaired individuals.
